intro: Scaphyglottis tafallae, commonly known as the Tafalla orchid, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure, which includes a specialized lip that aids in pollination. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, thriving in the humid microclimates of its native habitat. Its flowers are usually small and pale greenish-yellow, with intricate patterns that attract specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Scaphyglottis tafallae is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in preserving its natural environment.
